description_txt: stated on February 21, 2016 in an interview on "Meet the Press":
quote_txt: With Obamacare, "You have no options .. you can't get competitive bidding."

description_txt: stated on February 21, 2016 in an interview on "Meet the Press":
quote_txt: "About 70 percent of Republicans nationwide ... don't think Donald Trump is the right guy" to take on Hillary Clinton in November.

description_txt: stated on January 10, 2016 in comments on “This Week in Missouri Politics":
quote_txt: Says Missouri families’ "earning power is about $5,000 less today than it was at the turn of the century."

description_txt: stated on February 16, 2016 in a press release:
quote_txt: Blocking a U.S. Supreme Court nomination during the remaining months of President Obama’s term "would leave the nation’s highest court with an unprecedented year-long vacancy."

description_txt: stated on February 4, 2016 in remarks made during a state Senate Education Committee meeting.:
quote_txt: The Arizona State Board of Education’s "failure to report teachers whose certifications have been revoked or suspended ... resulted in the death of a student."

description_txt: stated on February 14, 2016 in a TV show:
quote_txt: In Sauk City, Wisconsin, "the ID office" that provides identification for voting "is only open on the fifth Wednesday of every month" -- a total of four days in 2016.

description_txt: stated on February 13, 2016 in a Republican debate:
quote_txt: "In New Hampshire, I spent $3 million. Jeb Bush spent $44 million. He came in five, and I came in number one."

description_txt: stated on January 26, 2016 in a column posted on Medium.com:
quote_txt: "Two-thirds of our kids can’t read at grade level."

description_txt: stated on February 15, 2016 in an appearance on MSNBC's Hardball:
quote_txt: "There's never been a (U.S. Supreme Court) vacancy in the last, I think, 30 years, lasting longer than 237 days."
footer: By C. Eugene Emery Jr. • February 18, 2016

description_txt: stated on February 5, 2016 in a column posted on Medium.com:
quote_txt: "Barack Obama will somehow manage to add more than $8 trillion to the national debt, which is more debt than the 43 presidents who held office before him compiled together."

description_txt: stated on January 28, 2016 in a web page:
quote_txt: In 2005 and 2007, " Joe Straus received a 100 percent rating by NARAL (the National Abortion and Reproductive Rights Action League)."

description_txt: stated on February 11, 2016 in a debate:
quote_txt: Says Dontre Hamilton, who was killed during a confrontation with a Milwaukee police officer, was "unarmed."

description_txt: stated on February 15, 2016 in comments on the "Late Show":
quote_txt: "People have actually broken down the transcripts for oral arguments and (Antonin Scalia) told more jokes and got more laughs than any of the other justices."

description_txt: stated on February 17, 2016 in his campaign website:
quote_txt: "We are almost halfway to our goal of 1,000 rapes prosecuted!"

description_txt: stated on February 9, 2016 in a MSNBC interview:
quote_txt: Nevada is "still a state that is 80 percent white voters."

description_txt: stated on February 7, 2016 in a video:
quote_txt: "The richest 80 people in the world own more wealth than the bottom half of the global population."

description_txt: stated on February 16, 2016 in a video ad on his campaign website:
quote_txt: Travis County residents "trusted me to take on Tom DeLay — and we won."

description_txt: stated on February 15, 2016 in a TV ad :
quote_txt: Says Hillary Clinton won "health care for 8 million children."

description_txt: stated on February 12, 2016 in a column posted on Medium.com:
quote_txt: Says she will "work to raise the federal minimum wage back to the highest level it’s ever been — $12 an hour in today’s dollars."

description_txt: stated on February 15, 2016 in an interview on Fox News:
quote_txt: Says Marco Rubio "went on Univision, and in Spanish he promised that he would not on the first day in office rescind President Obama's illegal executive action."

description_txt: stated on February 14, 2016 in a web ad:
quote_txt: Says Donald "Trump supported impeachment of President (George W.) Bush."

description_txt: stated on February 14, 2016 in on ABC's "This Week":
quote_txt: Says "the one person (Donald Trump) has suggested that would make a good justice is his sister, who is a court of appeals judge appointed by Bill Clinton. She is a hardcore pro-abortion liberal judge."

description_txt: stated on February 8, 2016 in remarks made on the Fox News segment, Outnumbered:
quote_txt: North Korea’s missiles are "not going to have a capability to reach the United States anytime real soon."

description_txt: stated on February 4, 2016 in an article posted on the group's website:
quote_txt: "The most likely triggering cause of (microcephaly)" is the "DTaP shot, a vaccine that had been recently mandated by the Brazilian government to be injected into pregnant women."

description_txt: stated on February 13, 2016 in the Republican debate in Charleston, S.C.:
quote_txt: "When Jeb (Bush) was governor, his first four years as governor, his Medicaid program grew twice as fast as mine."

description_txt: stated on January 28, 2016 in an Austin City Council meeting:
quote_txt: Since January 2015, the "majority of our" Austin City Council "meetings have extended past 10 p.m." and "many of our meetings have gone past midnight."

description_txt: stated on February 3, 2016 in a TV interview.:
quote_txt: "Under Virginia law, if you are a non-federally licensed (gun) dealer, you cannot get a background check even if you want one."

description_txt: stated on February 14, 2016 in comments on "Meet the Press":
quote_txt: "It has been 80 years since a Supreme Court vacancy was nominated and confirmed in an election year. There is a long tradition that you don't do this in an election year."

description_txt: stated on February 14, 2016 in comments on "Meet the Press":
quote_txt: "There comes a point in the last year of the president, especially in their second term, where you stop nominating" both Supreme Court justices and Court of Appeals judges.

description_txt: stated on February 8, 2016 in a TV ad:
quote_txt: Says state Supreme Court candidate Joe Donald twice "supported" incumbent Justice Rebecca Bradley.
